item.title: AdaptiveAvgPool2d in PyTorch
item.description: I had trouble understanding the AdaptiveAvgPool2d function in PyTorch. The following examples helped me to teach myself better. Hopefully, somebody may benefit from this. Example 1 import torch import torch.nn as nn import numpy as np m = nn.AdaptiveAvgPool2d((1)) x = np.array( [ [ 2. , 3.], [ 4. , 1.], ]) input = torch.tensor(x) print(input) output = m(input) print(output) print(torch.mean(input)) The output will be equal to torch.mean(input) Example 2 with a 3 x 3 x 3 tensor x = np.
